qas.question: What are the three sectors of construction?
Building construction is usually further divided into what categories?

answers.text: heavy/highway, heavy civil or heavy engineering
heavy/highway, heavy civil or heavy engineering
heavy/highway, heavy civil or heavy engineering

qas.question: Large public works, dams, bridges, highways, water/wastewater and utility distribution are under what construction sector?
Refineries, process chemical, power generation, mills and manufacturing plants are under what sector of construction?
What are buildings, stuctures and industrial?
What type of constuction is eivided into private and public buildings?
What sector includes large public works but not utility distribution?
What sector include utility distribution and refineries?
What three sectors of public works are there?
How is utility distribution further divided?

plausible_answers.text: heavy/highway, heavy civil or heavy engineering
large public works, dams, bridges, highways, water/wastewater and utility distribution

qas.question: What are some examples of markets?
What can residential and non-residential also be broken into?

context: In general, there are <b5_0>three sectors of construction<b5_0/>: <a0_0><a0_1><a0_2><b9_0>buildings, infrastructure and <b8_0>industrial<b9_0/><b8_0/><a0_2/><a0_1/><a0_0/>. <b6_0>Building construction<b6_0/> is usually further divided into <a1_0><a1_1><a1_2><b10_0>residential and non-residential<a1_0/> (commercial/institutional)<b10_0/><a1_2/><a1_1/>. <a3_0><a3_1><a3_2><b7_0>Infrastructure<b7_0/><a3_2/><a3_1/><a3_0/> is often called <a2_0><a2_1><a2_2><b11_0>heavy/highway, <a4_1>heavy civil or heavy engineering<b11_0/><a4_1/><a2_2/><a2_1/><a2_0/>. It includes <b12_0>large public works, dams, bridges, highways, water/wastewater and utility distribution<b12_0/>. <a4_0><a4_2>Industrial<a4_2/><a4_0/> includes refineries, process chemical, power generation, mills and manufacturing plants. There are other ways to break the industry into <b13_0>sectors or markets<b13_0/>.
